topic.title: Synchronization (Upload and Download) with WEB-based Shared Translation Memory Server

body.p: The panel Memory Replicator supports a real time memory replication with the server. In the left hand Available window all existing memories are listed, but they are not actively replicated with the server. You can select the memory you want to replicate, and move it to the Selected list window on the right-hand side. After having moved one or more translation memories to the Selected list window, the memories automatically start to be synchronized with server. This means, that the segments of the local translation memory are uploaded to server, and that segments of the WEB-based Translation Memory are download to the client.
If you don't want a memory to be synchronized with the server, you can just move it from Selected to the Available list window.

The Replication interval (in seconds) can be adjusted. The bigger the interval for memory replication is defined, the longer it takes to synchronize the local translation memory with the server translation memory. So it is better to set the Replication interval between 5 to 15 seconds. But there is no general rule â€“ observe the systems behaviour, and set the interval-time to a value where your infrastructure is supported the best.
